intro: Aostea, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are typically found in mountainous regions, particularly in the Alps and other high-altitude environments. They are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which can range in color from blue to purple. Aostea species often thrive in rocky soils and are adapted to cold climates. Their botanical features make them important components of alpine ecosystems.
